qas.question: What year did Germany decide to try DST?
What is the German word for Daylight Saving Time?
What natural resource were Germany and Austria-Hungary trying to conserve by using DST?
What year did the United States get on board with DST?

context: Starting on 30 April <a0_0>1916<a0_0/>, Germany and its World War I ally Austria-Hungary were the first to use DST (German: <a1_0>Sommerzeit<a1_0/>) as a way to conserve <a2_0>coal<a2_0/> during wartime. Britain, most of its allies, and many European neutrals soon followed suit. Russia and a few other countries waited until the next year and the United States adopted it in <a3_0>1918<a3_0/>.
